laboratory_examinations.findings: Recurrent deposits involved the anterior corneal stroma (80â€“150 /H9262m) and were mainly within 8 mm around the corneal center. The average depth of recurrent disease after PTK was 119.2 /H1100621.9 /H9262m for band keratopathy, 143.8/H110066.2/H9262m for MCD, 100.0 /H1100611.8/H9262m for ABMD, 118.5 /H1100611.3/H9262m for granular dystrophy, and 114.8 /H1100616.6/H9262m for lattice dystrophy.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: The depth and extension of recurrences tended to worsen over time. Recurrence was fastest for band keratopathy at an average of 7.8 months, then 12.4 months for ABMD, 13.5 months for MCD, 19.7 months for lattice dystrophy, and 23.7 months for granular dystrophy.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Morphologic changes included epithelial basement defects, disorganized stroma fibers, decreased density, disordered arrangement of nerve fibers, and occasional inconspicuous keratocyte nuclei.
